definition: ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: The Qing Dynasty is the Anhui local chronicle development prosperous time.
sentences.chinese: 清代是安徽方志发展的鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: 1912 - 1937 was the peak period of Jiangnan Dockyard in the history of old China.
sentences.chinese: 1937年是江南造船所在旧中国历史上的鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: The aging athlete's heyday is over.
sentences.chinese: 这个老运动员的鼎盛时期结束了。

sentences.english: The victory opened the period of great prosperity for Liubei.
sentences.chinese: 汉中争夺战的胜利，开启了刘备事业的鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: The great days of Hollywood have become legendry .
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞鼎盛时期成了神话。

sentences.english: In the middle of Yuan Dynasty, the terracotta technology in CiZao reached its peak.
sentences.chinese: 元朝中叶，磁灶制陶技术达到鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: Jungar-Russian relationship during prosperity of Khan Kingdom of Jungar will be discussed.
sentences.chinese: 第三章论述了准噶尔汗国鼎盛时期的准俄关系。

sentences.english: Traditional printing of woodcut developed its flouring at Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 传统版画在明代发展到了鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: What if this moment right now is the pinnacle of our life?
sentences.chinese: 如果现在就是我们人生的鼎盛时期，情况会怎么样呢？

sentences.english: Tang Dynasty, a Chinese Buddhism statue prosperous time.
sentences.chinese: 唐代，一个中国佛教造像的鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: Tang Dynasty was a period of full boom of the chant poems on chivalry.
sentences.chinese: 唐代是咏侠诗的繁荣鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: The Tang Dynasty was the most magnificent period in feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝是封建社会的鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: At his peak, he was able to produce up to 100 brooms a day.
sentences.chinese: 鼎盛时期，他曾经一天制作100多把扫帚。

sentences.english: There are some pictures from the golden age of our team.
sentences.chinese: 这有一些我队鼎盛时期的图片。

sentences.english: In the heyday of globalisation, small countries were fashionable and prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化鼎盛时期，小国成为时尚并且兴旺发达。

sentences.english: Old-style private education had reached unprecedented heyday in Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 私塾教育，在明代发展到了前所未有的鼎盛时期。

definition: flourishing age (of the ceremonial tripod)/golden age
all the rage for a time/grand fashion for a limited time
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
